p: The gum exudates from species of the Pistacia genus have been used for treatment of gastrointestinal disorders over a long period, at least ten centuries [ 20]; the antimicrobial effect of the essential oils of mastic gum against a number of microorganisms has been shown in vitro such as Staphylococcus aureus, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Escherichia coli, Candida albicans [ 21], E. coli, S. aureus, and S. pyogenes [ 16].
